title: SRV Record Builder
description: Compose SRV records with service discovery, protocol specification, priority/weight balancing, and target validation.

ttl.label: Default TTL (seconds)
ttl.tooltip: Default Time To Live in seconds for all SRV records

service.label: Service
service.tooltip: The service name, typically starting with underscore (e.g., _http, _smtp)

protocol.label: Protocol
protocol.tooltip: Transport protocol used by the service (TCP/UDP/TLS/SCTP)

domain.label: Domain
domain.tooltip: The domain name where this service is located

weight.label: Weight
weight.tooltip: Load balancing weight for same priority

port.label: Port
port.tooltip: Port number where the service is listening (1-65535)

target.label: Target (FQDN)
target.tooltip: Fully Qualified Domain Name of the server hosting the service (must end with dot)

validation.serviceUnderscore: Service name must start with underscore (_)
validation.targetFQDN: Target should end with a dot (FQDN)

info.title: SRV Record Structure
info.format: _service._protocol.domain. TTL IN SRV priority weight port target.
info.protocolDescription: Usually tcp, udp, tls, or sctp
info.targetDescription: FQDN of the server (must end with dot)

tableHeaders.ttlTooltip: Time To Live - how long DNS resolvers should cache this record
tableHeaders.typeTooltip: DNS record type (always SRV for service records)
tableHeaders.weightTooltip: Weight for load balancing among same priority records (0-65535)
tableHeaders.portTooltip: Port number where the service is available
tableHeaders.statusTooltip: Validation status of this SRV record
